question: For a 40 year-old woman whose mammogram does not detect cancer, what is the probability that she actually has cancer? Use the data from the Bayes' Rule section.

answers.feedback: No. Probabilities cannot be negative. Your work may contain a math error.
No. Probabilities cannot be greater than 1. Your work may contain a math error.

Apply Bayes' rule to write $P(\overline{F}| H_1 \cap H_2 \cap H_3)$ in terms of likelihoods and a priori probabilities. Give your answer as a fraction or a decimal accurate to at least 2 decimal places.
